availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John S. Reed (Bracken County, Kentucky, 1st lieut 40th KY Inf USA)

body.p: Bracken County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Minerva J. Hamilton in Bracken County on December 31, 1863. Father of William W. Reed and John Reed. Served in the 40th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant from July 30, 1863, to February 3, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Milford, p. 381B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bracken County Marriages, Film #000344094, p. 226.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 427.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0434.
Find A Grave, "John S Reed (1827-1907)," Memorial #101105794, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/101105794 (accessed August 4, 2020).
